title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the shape of the population pyramid indicates a high total fertility rate.

Two points for describing how the shape of the population pyramid indicates a high total fertility rate.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the total fertility rate indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following:
The response correctly describes the total fertility rate indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following :
The response correctly describes the total fertility rate indicated by the shape of the population pyramid shown using one of the following :

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating an agricultural factor that may contribute to population growth.

Two points for explaining how the trend shown on the graph relates to an agricultural factor that may contribute to population growth.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following agricultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following agricultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following agricultural factors that may contribute to the local population trend shown in the graph:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating a possible effect of in-migration.

Two points for explaining how the graph relates to a possible effect of in-migration.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which in-migration to this community may affect the population structure shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which in-migration to this community may affect the population structure shown in the graph:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which in-migration to this community may affect the population structure shown in the graph:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that demand for higher education will increase.

Two points for explaining how the population pyramid indicates that there will be an increased demand for higher education.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following possible outcomes regarding future higher-education demand based on the population pyramid shown:
The response correctly explains one of the following possible outcomes regarding future higher-education demand based on the population pyramid shown:
